English: French Demoralization

The Third Republic still yet reels from the First World War, and from the continually increasing threats across nearly every border and frontier. The public and indeed many in the government themselves see the prospect of a war in continental Europe as a catastrophe France has no hope of recovering from. Survival on the line, it will take much to bring France out of this malaise and back into the realm of action.
Memories of the Great War

The French Army still remembers the Great War, and has since adopted a deeply defensive doctrine meant to ensure that such a war can never happen again. This has led the army to have exceptional foresight in the development of strategic plans to contain a German offensive, but a severe lack in dynamism either amongst the rank and file or in the adoption of new doctrines.
The Bonaparte Cult of Offense

The French Bonaparte line has reformed the army structure around itself, building what many call a cult of the offensive around themselves. While this is a source of great pride to the reorganized French military, some critics point out that this is markedly similar to the French mentality before the Great War...
Napoleonic Ambition

Characteristic to the Bonaparte line in particular is the ever-present legacy of one figure that looms large in the French psyche. Napoleon's legacy lives on in France, and the Bonaparte line is showing the characteristic signs of that same ambition that drove a man to conquer all of Europe once before.
French Advisors

The French have sent advisors and monetary aid in order to help modernize the Polish military. Whilst the French themselves are already behind in many affairs, and therefore are not of much aid in this particular regard, their officers still provide a valuable pool of experience and military expertise so as to generally improve the structure of the military.
The Wehrmacht Regime

The German Reich has been in a state of de facto martial law ever since the putsch of 1939. The Wehrmacht's military government has since funneled much of its funds into the military in order to help cement its regime. For obvious reasons, the military government is less than popular, and it will almost certainly need comprehensive reform if it is to survive the coming years.
Defunded Wehrmacht
The Wehrmacht has been stripped of many resources and much of its national funding. As such, its entire military structure is withering on the vine.
Expanded Wehrmacht
The Wehrmacht has seen yet another hike in its funding, leading to a new boom in the recruitment of officers, acquisition of equipment, and expansion of personnel, albeit at great cost to the state.
Elections Denied
The government has fervently denied the possibility of elections being held once again, and this has caused a severe uptick in militant sentiments amongst the general population.
Elections Promised

The government has promised the opening of elections to the general population. While this promise may of course be reneged upon in the future, this has indeed greatly reduced militancy in the meantime.
Junkers Angered
The Junkers have been dislanded and many of their estates seized. The opposition of this aristocratic element of German society will severely harm the state for years to come.
Junker Estates
The Junkers have been secured as a political pillar of the German state, which has secured the support of this aristocratic element for years to come.
Reichskomissariat
The state is dominated by German foreigners in a system of thorough economic exploitation, denying all industrial integration in the name of resource extraction.
